availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel S. Miner (Maysville, Kentucky, shoe merchant)

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, shoe merchant. Connecticut native. Married to Araminta Brooks Miner on December 12, 1835. Father of Julia S. Miner, Mary E. Miner, Betty B. Miner, Amanda S. Miner, Esther F. Miner, Charles Miner, and William Miner. Shoe merchant in Maysville in 1850 and 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Mason County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Maysville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 105B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2, p. 20.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 29.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 4, p. 1.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000281842, p. 96.
